definitions.definition: the obtaining or developing of something from a source or origin.
examples: the derivation of scientific laws from observation
synonyms: eliciting "the derivation of theories from empirical observation"

definitions.definition: the formation of a word from another word or from a root in the same or another language.
examples: origin, etymology, root, etymon, provenance, source; Moreorigination, beginning, foundation, basis, cause; development, evolution "the derivation of a word"Moreorigination, beginning, foundation, basis, cause; development, evolution the derivation of a word

definitions.definition: in generative grammar, the set of stages that link the abstract underlying structure of an expression to its surface form.
the process of deducing a new formula, theorem, etc., from previously accepted statements.
a sequence of statements showing that a formula, theorem, etc., is a consequence of previously accepted statements.
